the paint shall show no cracking or flaking when tested in accordance with federal specification ttpnumb .
num water resistance .
the paint shall conform to federal specification ttpnumb .
there shall be no blistering or appreciable loss of adhesion softening or other deterioration after examination .
num freezethaw stability .
the paint shall show no coagulation or change in consistency greater than num kreb units when tested in accordance with federal specification ttpnumb .
num heat stability .
the paint shall show no coagulation discoloration or change in consistency greater than num kreb units when tested in accordance with federal specification ttpnumb .
num dilution test .
the paint shall be capable of dilution with water at all levels without curdling or precipitation such that the wet paint can be readily cleaned up with water only .
num storage stability .
after num days of storage in a num filled closed container the paint shall show no caking that can not be readily remixed to a smooth homogeneous state and shall show no skinning livering curdling or hard settling .
the viscosity shall change no more than num kreb units from the viscosity of the original sample .
num contrast ratio .
the minimum contrast ratio hiding power shall be num when drawn down with a num bird film applicator on a numa or numc leneta chart or equal and airdried for num hours .
the contrast ratio shall be calculated as follows contrast ratio blackwhite .
num reflectance .
the daylight directional reflectance of a nummil wet film applied to a numa or numc leneta chart or equal and dried for a minimum of num hours shall be no less than num percent for the white paint and no less than num percent for the yellow paint .
num bleeding .
the paint shall have a minimum bleeding ratio of num when tested in accordance with federal specification ttpnumb .
the asphalt saturated felt shall be in accordance with astm d num for type i .
num dry through time .
the paint shall be applied to a nonabsorbent substrate at a wet film thickness of num num mil and placed in a humidity chamber controlled at num num percent relative humidity and num num f. the dry through time shall be determined in accordance with astm d num num return to table of contents except that the pressure exerted shall be the minimum needed to maintain contact with the thumb and film .
num acceptance .
num except as noted each batch or lot of paint shall be sampled and approved by the engineer prior to use .
num no paint shall be used that is more than num months old .
num in addition to the requirements of sec num the certification supplied by the manufacturer shall include reference to the specific ntpep test deck to which the paint formulation was applied including ntpep identification numbers and report numbers .
num durable pavement marking materials .
num plural component pavement marking materials .
num epoxy pavement marking materials .
num fast cure epoxy pavement marking materials .
num general .
epoxy pavement marking material shall not contain toxic heavy metals .
the material shall be twocomponent num percent solids and formulated and tested to perform as a pavement marking material with glass beads applied to the surface .
the two components shall be epoxy resin and an amine curing agent .
num toxicity .
upon heating to application temperature the material shall not release fumes that are toxic to persons or property .
upon curing the material shall be completely inert with all components fully reacted and environmentally benign .
num no track time .
the material shall have a notrack time of num minutes or less when mixed in the proper proportions and applied at a nummil wet film thickness at num num f with the proper application of glass beads and when tested in accordance with astm d num .
the material shall fully cure under a constant surface temperature of num f or above .
num adhesion to concrete .
the pavement marking material shall have a high degree of adhesion to the concrete surface such that there is a num percent concrete failure when tested in accordance with aci num appendix a.num .
the prepared specimens shall have a film thickness of num num mil and shall be applied to concrete with a minimum compressive strength of num psi .
the concrete surface shall be num num f when the material is applied .
the applied material shall be cured for num hours at num num before performing the test .
num hardness .

num tensile strength .

num compressive strength .
the material shall have a minimum compressive strength of num psi after num hours of cure at num num f when tested in accordance with astm d num .
num abrasion resistance .

num durable preformed pavement marking materials .
num cold applied preformed pavement marking tape materials .
num application .
after application the tape shall be immediately ready to receive traffic .
num composition .
cold applied preformed pavement marking tape shall consist of a mixture of polymeric material and pigments with beads distributed throughout the crosssectional area and with a reflective layer of glass beads embedded in the surface .
the marking shall be capable of adhering to bituminous or concrete surfaces by a flexible conforming backing .
a primer may be required to precondition the pavement surface .
num dimensions .
the marking tape as supplied shall be free of cracks and have edges true straight and unbroken .
the actual width of the rolls of preformed tape shall be no less than the nominal stated width and no more than num in .
greater than the nominal width .
the length shall be no less than the length stated .
num adhesion .
the tape shall be supplied with a precoated factoryapplied pressure sensitive adhesive .
the marking tape shall have minimum adhesion values as shown in table num of astm dnum .
num color .
the white and yellow marking tape shall conform to the requirements of astm dnum .
num reflectance .

the tape shall be applied to an num x numinch panel per instrument recommendation for pavement marking tape and measured in accordance with modot test method tm num at prescribed cen geometry .

section num dropon glass beads .
num general .

num type p dropon glass beads .

num return to table of contents section num precast concrete box culverts num scope .
this specification covers precast concrete box culverts .
num acceptance .
the basis of acceptance will be with producers qmp in accordance with sec num .
num lot size definition .
a lot is defined as one days production .
num quality control .
the producer qmp shall define quality control testing and inspection frequencies and shall include the following minimum requirements .
num compressive strength of cylinders or cores shall be taken at a minimum of once per lot in accordance with astm cnum .
compressive strength testing shall also be performed to control handling and curing operations .
cylinders shall be cured in accordance with aashto tnum field curing procedures .
num air and slump of fresh concrete shall be taken a minimum of once per lot .
num aggregate gradation absorption and deleterious shall be checked a minimum of once per month per aggregate source in accordance with sec num .
num steel placement shall be checked and documented for each unit .
num finished dimensions shall be checked and documented for each unit .
num all equipment used for testing shall be maintained and calibrated in accordance with aashto rnum or equivalent program .
num concrete plants shall be calibrated and monitored in accordance with the producers qmp .
num quality assurance .
the qmp shall reference an industry organization or define independent qa testing frequencies including the following tested propertya test method independent qa air tnum twice a year slump tnum twice a year coarse aggregate deleterious tmnum twice a year coarse aggregate absorption tnum twice a year compressive strength tnum twice a year absorption per mix tnum once a year a all samples shall be taken at the precast plant num modot hold points .
num modot shall verify steel placement prior to concrete pour .
num prior to shipping producers shall notify modot and obtain a modot identification numbers .
num repair methods and completion of repairs for nonconforming work shall be approved by the engineer .
num modot quality assurance and auditing .
the engineer may perform qa testing and audit the producers qmp documentation and production at any time which may include coring of the precast units at the producers expense .
num deficient work .
a procedure addressing deficient work in accordance with sec num .
num return to table of contents num filling of form tie cavities and repair of other defects shall be in accordance with sec num .
num nonconforming work .
a procedure addressing nonconforming work in accordance with sec num .
num material .
num cement .
cement shall be in accordance with sec num .
num fly ash .
fly ash shall be in accordance with sec num .
num ground granulated blast furnace slag .
ground granulated blast furnace slag shall be in accordance with the requirements of sec num .
num aggregate .
fine and coarse aggregate for the concrete mixture shall be in accordance with sec num except the requirements for gradation and percent passing the no .
num sieve will not apply .
num steel reinforcement .
reinforcement shall be in accordance with sec num .
num concrete mixture .
concrete shall be a minimum of num psi in accordance with astm cnum and the mix design shall be approved by the engineer .
admixtures or blends may be used with approval from engineer .
num design .
except as otherwise specified herein precast concrete box sections for the culvert shall be in accordance with astm c num .
designs shall be submitted to the inspecting district .
num substituted precast concrete box culvert sections shall be designed for the earth cover shown on the plans for the castinplace box culvert and shall be equal in height and cross sectional area or as approved by the engineer .
num special designs .
the producer shall request approval of any modified and special designs which differ from the designs in astm c num .
the request for such modified and special designs shall fully describe any deviations from those standards including a drawing showing wall thickness concrete design strength the type size and placement of reinforcement and inside or outside dimensions of both of the box sections .
num the minimum barrel length for box or end section shall be num feet .
num end sections may be precast or castinplace .
if precast the barrel floor and wing walls shall be cast as an integral unit .
in either case the end sections shall be constructed to the same dimensions shapes and with the same reinforcement as shown on the plans for castinplace culvert .
num segmented end sections may be provided but will be considered a modified design and will require approval as such .
num toe walls shall be provided on both the upstream and downstream ends as shown on the plans and may be castinplace or precast .
precast toe walls shall be connected to the end section floor .
num manufacture .
num curing .
curing shall be in accordance with sec num until the concrete has developed the specified compressive strength .
num the producer shall ensure that the placing finishing and consolidating of concrete is in accordance with their producer quality management plan .
temperatures shall be maintained to prevent detrimental effects to precast production and the following a concrete placed in cold weather shall be protected from freezing during the curing period by the use of a heated weatherproof enclosure .
concrete shall not be placed on or against reinforcing num return to table of contents steel or other surfaces with temperatures lower than num f. no concrete shall be placed when the enclosure ambient temperature is below num f. the temperature of the mixed concrete when placed shall be no higher than num f. the forms and reinforcing steel shall be cooled by acceptable methods to an ambient temperature of num f or lower .
num permissible variations .
dimensions position of reinforcement area of reinforcement and haunch dimensions shall be in accordance with astm cnum .
num marking .
the following information shall be legibly marked on each box section by indentation waterproof paint or other approved means .
box section span rise maximum and minimum design earth cover and specification designation .
a date of manufacture .
b name or trademark of the manufacturer .
c indicator required by the qc program .
d sample identification number .
e station where the unit will be installed .
f each section shall be clearly marked on either the inner or the outer surface during the process of manufacture .
in addition the word top shall be lettered with waterproof paint on the inside of the top surface .
num modot identification number .
the producer shall contact the engineer a minimum of one business day prior to shipping precast products .
the engineer shall assign a specific modot identification number for each size and type of product in the shipment .
num prior to delivery to the jobsite the source intermediate agent shipper or contractors representative shall notify the inspecting district by fax or electronically a minimum of one business day or earlier prior to the impending shipment of precast material .
this notification shall include a shipping form precast shipping form and will include at minimum the following a contract number and project number .
b receiving purchasercontractor .
c type and quantity of material .
d date of expected delivery to the jobsite .
e manufacturers name .
f stationing or structure number on precast unit if applicable .
num the precast unit shall be clearly and permanently marked by the precaster with the id number in accordance with sec num prior to shipment .
requests for alternate precast labeling shall be submitted to the inspecting district for approval .
material without proper identification number shall not be permitted for use on a project .
num delivery .
a bill of lading or delivery receipt for each shipment shall be furnished to the engineer at the destination point .
the bill of lading shall contain an itemized statement of the sizes and lengths of precast units with the corresponding designated modot identification number provided to the manufacturer for each size and type of precast unit for that shipment .
the bill of lading shall contain a certified statement .
the certified statement shall be signed by an authorized representative of the manufacturer and shall state the following num return to table of contents this certifies that the precast products in this shipment are in accordance with modot specifications .
num return to table of contents section num lumber timber piling posts and poles num scope .
this specification covers wood products as defined in the awpa standards .
num posts .
num posts and blocks for guardrail .
posts and blocks for guardrail shall be rectangular standard rough sawn and of the size and length shown on the plans .
posts and blocks shall be pressure treated in accordance with sec num .
all framing and boring shall be completed before treatment .
douglas fir shall be dense no .
num structural grade in accordance with paragraph numbb of the current standard grading rules for west coast lumber .
southern pine shall be no .
num dense grade in accordance with paragraph num of the current standard grading rules for southern pine lumber .
num posts for fence .
posts for fence shall be round and of the sizes and lengths shown on the plans .
posts shall be pressuretreated in accordance with sec num .
allowable tolerances for size and length will be as follows fence post tolerances dimension tolerance numinch diameter num no minus tolerance numinch diameter num inch no minus tolerance all lengths any diameter no limit on over length minus num inch num grade .
wood for posts shall be sound free of decay excessive knots and of end splits and seasoning checks that might affect serviceability .
posts shall be free of multiple crooks except crooks in one plane only in accordance with sec num will be permitted .
num straightness .
a straight line drawn from the center of one end of the post to the center of the opposite end shall not deviate from the longitudinal axis of the post at any point more than one percent of the length of the post .
num manufacture .
posts shall be clean peeled to remove all bark except that strips of inner bark no more than num inch wide or more than num inches long will be permitted to remain on the peeled post .
all protruding knots shall be trimmed flush and all spurs and splinters shall be removed .
the natural taper of round posts shall be followed in machine peeling operations .
the ends of all posts shall be cut square except posts to be driven shall be machinepointed on the small end prior to treatment .
num posts for onestrand access restraint cable .
posts for onestrand access restraint cable may be round or rectangular as shown on the plans .
round posts shall be in accordance with sec num .
rectangular posts shall be standard rough sawn and of the grade specified in sec num .
all posts shall be in accordance with sec num .
num posts for signs .
posts for signs shall be rectangular rough sawn or surfaced four sides snums with square cut ends and shall be of the grade size and length shown on the plans .
posts shall be pressuretreated in accordance with sec num .
other preservatives and wood species shall be in accordance with applicable awpa standards .
if framing and boring is completed after pressure treatment field treatment shall be in accordance with sec num .
num permanent .
project sign posts shall be treated to use category uc numb .
num temporary .
post for temporary use shall be treated to uc numa .
num lumber and timber .
num species and grade requirements .
unless otherwise specified lumber and timber to be used as num return to table of contents a permanent part of a structure shall be one of the species shown in table i or other treatable species as specified in the awpa standards and of the grade specified on the plans .
lumber and timber for temporary structures shall be of the species and grades shown on the plans .
num dressing requirements .
lumber and timber shall be standard rough sawn or shall be surfaced as specified in the contract .
lumber and timber shall be cut to exact lengths or to permissible variations in lengths shown in the contract documents .
num treatment .
if treatment is specified lumber and timber shall be pressuretreated in accordance with sec num .
num electric substation service and span wire assembly poles .
num electric substation and services poles .
electric substation and service poles shall be of the length and class specified in the contract documents and shall be in accordance with ansi onum .
poles shall be pressure treated in accordance with sec num .
poles may be gained and drilled in the field after treatment .
areas exposed shall be treated in accordance with sec num before crossarms or equipment are mounted .
num span wire assembly poles .
span wire assembly poles shall be of the length specified in the contract and shall be in accordance with ansi num class iv unless otherwise specified .
the poles shall be pressure treated in accordance with sec num .
all poles shall have a minimum diameter of num num inches measured at the top of the pole .
num pole crossarms .
the species grade and treatment of crossarms to be erected on substation and service poles will be shown on the plans .
num round timber piles .
num material .
all round timber piles shall be in accordance with astm d num except for size which shall be in accordance with table i for the class specified in the contract .
num chemical treatment .
piles shall be pressure treated in accordance with sec num .
framing and boring will not be required before treatment .
exposed untreated areas resulting from framing of treated piling shall be field treated in accordance with sec num .
untreated piles for use in unexposed locations or in temporary bridges shall be of the species approved by the engineer .
num timber preservatives .
pressure preservative treatment shall be in accordance with current aashto standard mnum .
num responsibility for quality .
the contractor shall use preservatives that meet these specifications or the treated material will be subject to rejection or to approved retreatment with an approved preservative .
num care after treatment .
care shall be taken in handling pressuretreated material to avoid damage .
cant hooks peavies pickaroons and end cant hooks shall not be used on the side surfaces of treated material .
all handling of treated round stock with pointed tools shall be confined to the ends .
if damaged material is permitted for use by the engineer or framing at site is required remediation following current awpa standard mnum shall be followed .
num inspection requirements .
num inspection .
all material shall be inspected for compliance with these specifications in accordance with awpa standard mnum .
num timber products treated within the state of missouri or within num air miles of the border may be inspected by modot personnel .
num the inspection of lumber timber piling posts and poles shall be performed by the supplier or num return to table of contents an approved inspection agency and the cost for inspection shall be at the contractors expense .
num inspection agency .
an approved inspection agency will be a laboratory accredited by the american lumber standards committee p.o .
box num germantown md or an experienced testing laboratory approved by the engineer .
inspection agencies not accredited by the american lumber standards committee shall submit for approval a resume to construction and materials .
the resume of the agency shall include the agencys history of inspection of timber and treated products a listing of state highway agencies which have approved the inspection agency and a listing of state agencies for which the inspection agency has performed inspection .
num certification .
the contractor shall furnish to the engineer certification from the supplier or inspection agency that the material furnished is in accordance with these specifications .
certification shall include or shall have attached a listing of the material being supplied .
except as noted the certification shall have attached a certified test report as detailed in section num of awpa standard mnum from the supplier or inspection agency attesting to complete compliance with awpa and these specifications .
electric substation service and span wire assembly poles will not require certified test reports .
num acceptance .
acceptance of material will be based on satisfactory suppliers certification or inspection agency certifications and upon results of any tests deemed necessary by the engineer at destination to ascertain compliance with these specifications .

this specification covers slotted drain .
num pipe .
the pipe portion of the slotted drain shall be num gage .
the material and fabrication of the pipe shall be in accordance with sec num .
the diameter of the pipe shall be as shown on the plans .
num slotted drain grate assembly .
the grate assembly of type a b or c slotted drain shall be fabricated as shown on the plans .
the grate assembly shall be num inches high unless otherwise specified on the plans .
num type b and type c slotted drain grate assemblies shall be fabricated from numinch thick astm a num structural steel .
the entire grate assembly shall be hot dip galvanized prior to attachment to the pipe in accordance with aashto m num .
num type a slotted drain guide assemblies shall be fabricated from num gage galvanized steel meeting the same material requirements as the pipe .
the drain guide slot shall be assembled with mechanical interlocks requiring no welding .
num all coupling devices and other necessary fittings shall be in accordance with sec num .
num return to table of contents section num mechanically stabilized earth wall system components num this specification covers material requirements for metallic soil reinforcement nonmetallic soil reinforcement concrete facing panels for large block wall systems and concrete blocks for small block wall systems that are supplied as part of mechanically stabilized earth wall systems .

section num metallic soil reinforcement .
num scope .
this specification covers metallic soil reinforcement and the accompanying attachments utilized in mechanically stabilized earth wall systems .
num reinforcement strips .
metallic soil reinforcement strips shall be in accordance with the specifications of the manufacturer of the wall system and the contract documents .
the minimum grade of steel for strips and connection devices shall be aashto m num grade num .
num reinforcement mesh .
metallic soil reinforcement mesh shall be in accordance with the specifications of the manufacturer of the wall system and the contract documents .
the minimum grade of steel for strips and connection devices shall be either aashto m num grade num astm a num grade num or astm a num grade num .
welding shall be in accordance with aashto m num .
num fasteners .
fasteners shall consist of either aashto m num hexagon head bolts or aashto m num hexagonal cap screws with nuts and washers .
num galvanizing and aluminizing .
all soil reinforcement material shall be either galvanized or aluminized .
galvanized soil reinforcement shall be in accordance with aashto m num .
aluminized soil reinforcement shall be in accordance with astm a num aluminized type num ss grade num class num .
fasteners including bolts nuts and washers shall be galvanized in accordance with aashto m num .
all connection devices shall be galvanized in accordance with either aashto m num or m num .
num certification .
the manufacturer of the wall system shall certify in writing that the soil reinforcement connections and fasteners meet the minimum requirements directed by the design and this specification .
the contractor shall provide this certification and any other supporting documentation to the engineer prior to the material being delivered to the construction site .
section num nonmetallic soil reinforcement .
num scope .
this specification covers nonmetallic or geosynthetic soil reinforcement utilized in mechanically stabilized earth wall systems .
num geogrids .
nonmetallic or geosynthetic soil reinforcement shall be of a polymeric nature and shall consist of a geogrid determined by the wall manufacturer or supplier .
num the geogrid shall be dimensionally stable and shall be able to maintain geometry during transport handling and installation .
num the geogrid manufacturer shall maintain a quality control program to ensure that the manufactured material meets the requirements of the index tests shown below .
sampling and conformance testing for the index tests shown in the table shall be done in accordance with astm d num .
geogrids property test procedure specific gravity hdpe only astm d num wide width tensile astm d num gri ggnum melt flow hdpe and pp only astm d num inherent viscosity pet only astm d num gri ggnum hydrolysis resistance pet only gri ggnum uv oxidation resistance astm d num num return to table of contents survivability astm d num num certification .
the manufacturer of geogrid shall certify in writing that the geogrid is in accordance with this specification .
the certification shall include the roll numbers and identification the sampling procedures the results of the quality control tests along with the tests used and the minimum average roll value marv for each roll .
this certification and any other supporting documentation shall be provided to the engineer prior to the material being delivered to the construction site .
section num mse panel and sound walls .
num scope .
this specification covers the concrete facing panels used as part of mechanically stabilized earth wall systems and sound wall systems .
num acceptance .
num lot definition .
a production lot will be defined as a group of panels and precast posts that will be represented by a single compressive strength sample and shall consist of either num panels and or precast posts or single days production whichever is less .
num quality control .
the qmp shall define qc testing and inspection frequencies including the following .
num compressive strength of cylinders or cores shall be taken at least once a lot in accordance with aashto mnum .
compressive strength testing may also be performed to control handling and curing operations .
cylinders shall be cured in accordance with aashto tnum field curing procedures .
for field cure compressive strength samples sufficient cylinders shall be cured in the same manner as the panels and precast posts and tested in accordance with aashto tnum shall represent the initial strength of the concrete .
in addition a set of cylinders shall be cured in accordance with aashto tnum and tested at num days .
the average compressive strength of these cylinders when tested in accordance with aashto tnum shall represent the compressive strength of the production lot .
num air content testing shall be performed in accordance with aashto tnum or aashto tnum .
air content samples shall be taken at the beginning of each days production and at the same time as compressive samples are taken to ensure compliance with this specification .
num slump testing shall be performed in accordance with aashto tnum .
the slump shall be determined at the beginning of each days production and at the same time as the compressive strength samples are taken .
num aggregate gradation and quality shall be checked at least once a month per aggregate source to ensure compliance with the specifications .
num steel placement shall be checked for each unit .
num all equipment used for testing shall be maintained and calibrated in accordance with aashto rnum or equivalent program .
num qc shall ensure the concrete plant is calibrated monitored and maintained in a manner sufficient to provide uniform compliant concrete .
num quality assurance .
the qmp shall reference an industry organization or define independent qa testing frequencies including the following tested propertya test method independent qa air tnum twice a year slump tnum twice a year coarse aggregate deleterious tmnum twice a year coarse aggregate absorption tnum twice a year compressive strength tnum twice a year num return to table of contents absorption per mix tnum once a year a all samples shall be taken at the precast plant .
num modot qa and auditing .
the engineer may perform modot qa testing or audit the producers qmp documentation and production at any time which may include coring of the precast units at the producers expense .
num other criteria .
concrete facing panels coping and precast posts will not be accepted if any of the following defects in physical characteristics are found imperfect molding honeycombing or open texture concrete cracked or severely chipped panels and precast posts soil reinforcement attachment devices improperly installeddamaged lifting inserts not useable exposed reinforcing steel and color variation on the front face of the panel due to excess form oil or other reasons .
num material .
num concrete .
concrete material proportioning air entraining mixing slump and transporting of concrete shall be in accordance with sec num except as noted in this section .
num aggregate .
fine and coarse aggregate for the concrete mixture shall be in accordance with sec num except that the requirements for gradation and percent passing the no .
num sieve will not apply .
num steel reinforcement .
reinforcement shall be in accordance with sec num .
num design .
shop drawings shall be approved by the bridge division when the mse wall is constructed in conjunction with a bridge abutment .
num the concrete shall be an approved modot mix that is airentrained with a minimum compressive strength of num psi at num days .
no additional admixtures will be permitted unless approved by the engineer .
num casting .
the panels shall be cast in such a manner that the acceptance criteria of this specification are met .
soil reinforcement connection devices shall not be in contact with or attached to the reinforcing steel in the concrete facing panels .
num manufacturing .
num casting .
the panels and precast posts shall be cast in such a manner that the acceptance criteria of this specification are met .
soil reinforcement connection devices shall not be in contact with or attached to the reinforcing steel in the concrete facing panels .
num curing .
one of the following methods shall be used .
curing as recommended by the wall designer .
curing membrane in accordance with sec num may be applied and if used shall be left intact until the strength requirements are met .
steam and moisture curing methods shall be in accordance with sec num .
num tolerances .
num panel and post systems .
shall be in accordance with approved shop drawings .
any variations from the approved shop drawings such as dimensions materials or finish must be approved by the wall manufacturer .
post dimensions for sound walls shall be within num inch in width and depth and within one inch along the length dimension .
num panel dimensions .
panel connection devices shall be within one inch of the specified dimension .
the panel face and thickness dimensions shall be within num inch of the specified dimension .
all other dimensions or items shall be within num inch of the specified dimensions .
num panel squareness .
squareness as determined by the difference between the two diagonals shall not exceed num inch .
num return to table of contents num panel surface finish .
surface defects on smooth formed surfaces measured over a length of num feet shall not exceed num inch .
surface defects on the textured finish surfaces measured over a length of num feet shall not exceed num inch .
num other criteria .
concrete facing panels coping and precast posts will not be accepted if any of the following defects in physical characteristics are found imperfect molding honeycombing or open texture concrete cracked or severely chipped panels and precast posts soil reinforcement attachment devices improperly installeddamaged lifting inserts not usable exposed reinforcing steel and color variation on the front face of the panel due to excess form oil or other reasons .
num marking .
the date of manufacture production lot number and piece mark shall be clearly scribed on an unexposed face of each panel .
num modot identification number .
when the manufacturer contacts the engineer one business day or earlier in advance of shipping precast products the engineer will assign a specific modot identification number for each size and type of product in the shipment .
num prior to delivery to the jobsite the source intermediate agent shipper or contractors representative shall notify the inspecting district by fax or electronically a minimum of one business day or earlier prior to the impending shipment of precast material .
this notification shall include a shipping form precast shipping form and will include at minimum the following a the specific contract number .
b receiving purchasercontractor .
c line number for which the material will be used .
d type and quantity of material .
e date of expected delivery to the jobsite .
f manufacturers name .
g stationing or structure number on precast unit if applicable .
h panel type quantity and wall number for mse panels .
num upon approval the precaster will receive an identification number .
the precast unit shall be clearly and permanently marked by the precaster with the id number as required by appropriate num specification prior to shipment .
requests for alternate precast labeling shall be submitted to the inspecting district for approval .
material without proper identification numbers will not be permitted for use on a project .
num handling storage and shipping .
all panels shall be free of chips discoloration cracks fractures and any other defects determined to be detrimental to the cosmetic value or to the performance characteristics of the panels .
the panels shall not be subjected to excessive bending stresses and the panel connection devices and exposed exterior finish shall be protected from damage .
num documentation .
copies of test results for all required tests and any other supporting documentation shall be in accordance with sec num .
num delivery .
a bill of lading or delivery receipt shall be furnished to the engineer at the destination point .
the bill of lading shall contain an itemized statement of the sizes and lengths of precast units with the corresponding modot identification number provided to the manufacturer for each size and type of precast unit for that shipment .
the bill of lading shall contain a certified statement .
the certified statement shall be signed by an authorized representative of the manufacturer and shall state the following this certifies that the precast products in this shipment are in accordance with modot specifications .
num return to table of contents section num small block wall systems concrete blocks .
num scope .
this specification covers the concrete blocks used as part of small block mechanically stabilized earth wall systems .
wet cast blocks shall be produced in accordance with sec num .
dry cast blocks shall be produced at stated below .
num acceptance .
acceptance will be based upon manufacture test results compliant with the following requirements .
num freeze thaw testing .
the concrete blocks shall be tested for freezethaw durability in accordance with astm cnum .
freezethaw durability shall be based on tests from five specimens made with the same material concrete mix design manufacturing process and curing method conducted not more than num months prior to delivery .
test results will be required for each project .
num units that are not exposed to deicing salts shall be in accordance with the following testing requirements .
when tested in water the weight loss of each of five test specimens at the conclusion of num cycles shall not exceed num percent of its initial weight or the weight loss of each of four of the five test specimens at the conclusion of num cycles shall not exceed num percent of its initial weight .
num test results for units that are exposed to deicing salts shall be tested in a num percent saline solution and shall be in accordance with the following a when tested in num percent saline solution the weight loss of each of five test specimens at the conclusion of num cycles shall not exceed num percent of the initial weight or the weight loss of each of four of the five test specimens at the conclusion of num cycles shall not exceed num percent of its initial weight .
num compressive strength .
acceptance of the compressive strength of the concrete blocks will be based on production lots in compliance with astm cnum .
acceptance of the compressive strength of a production lot will occur if the compressive strength test results is equal to or greater than the design strength at num days .
the engineer of record shall evaluate and approve acceptance of deviations below design strength .
num absorption .
the manufacturer shall sample and test units based on production lots for absorption in accordance with astm cnum .
num dimensional tolerances .
concrete blocks shall be manufactured within the following tolerances a the length and width of each concrete block shall be within num inch of the specified dimension .
b the height of each concrete block shall be within num inch of the specified dimension .
c when a broken face finish is used the dimension of the front face shall be within one inch of the theoretical dimension of the concrete block .
num other criteria .
all concrete blocks shall be sound and free of cracks or other defects that would interfere with the proper placement of the blocks or significantly impair the strength or permanence of the construction .
at the time of the delivery to the work site the concrete blocks shall a a maximum water absorption of num percent .
b minor cracks incidental to the usual method of manufacture or minor chipping resulting from shipment and delivery will not be grounds for rejection .
minor cracks will be defined as cracks that are no wider than num inch and no longer than num percent of the block height .
c any exposed face of a concrete block shall be free of chips cracks or other imperfections when viewed from a distance of num feet under diffused lighting .
up to num percent of a shipment may num return to table of contents contain slight cracks or small chips no larger than one inch .
num concrete blocks shall not be accepted if any of the requirements specified above or the following defects in physical characteristics are found a defects indicating imperfect molding .
b defects indicating honeycomb or open texture concrete .
c cracked or severely chipped blocks .
d color variation on front face of blocks .
num material .
num concrete .
concrete material proportioning air entraining mixing slump and transporting of concrete shall be in accordance with sec num except as noted in this section .
coloring pigments integral water repellants finely ground silica and other constituents shall be previously directed as suitable for use and shall be in accordance with applicable astm standards or evidence shall be provided to prove the product is not detrimental to the durability of the concrete blocks or any material customarily used in masonry construction .
num aggregate .
fine and coarse aggregate for the concrete mixture shall be in accordance with sec num except that the requirements for gradation and percent passing the no .
num sieve will not apply .
num design .
the concrete mixture shall have a minimum compressive strength of num psi at num days .
the design including all contents of the mixture and curing method shall be submitted to the engineer for approval prior to use .
num manufacturing .
num finish color .
color and finish shall be as shown on the plans .
if no color or finish is specified on the plans the contractor shall provide a color and finish to the engineer for approval .
num certification .
the manufacturer of the concrete blocks shall certify that the concrete blocks are in accordance with this specification .
this certification copies of test results for all required tests and any other supporting documentation shall be provided to the engineer prior to the material being shipped to the construction site .
num return to table of contents section num concrete sealer and concrete crack filler section num penetrating concrete sealer num scope .
this specification covers concrete sealers for the protection of concrete against damage from deicing chemicals .
num acceptance .
all material under this specification shall be obtained from a source identified on the pal designated for this specification .
all material under this specification will be inspected and accepted in accordance with sec num .
astm and aashto specifications when referenced control only the physical and chemical properties of the material .
num the sealer shall be a alkyltrialkoxysilane with low oligomer and polymer compound content .
the chemical composition shall meet the following requirements property specification purity num minimum monomer by weight solvent less than num by weight residue less than num by weight density per the manufacturers recommendation flash point astm dnum greater than num degrees f dry time astm dnum sec num one hour or less numthe astm dnum test shall be performed on a concrete surface .
this concrete shall be a mix design called for in sec num .
the application rate shall be the same rate specified in sec num .
num the sealer shall meet the following performance criteria based on a single application at the application rate specified in sec num .
modot reserves the right to verify any qualification tests at their expense on any field application .
test specimens shall be produced using either the modot class bnum concrete in accordance with sec num or the concrete mix specified by the test being performed .
test test method duration max absorption cl water immersion astm cnum num hours num percent by weight mass water immersion astm cnum num days num percent by weight mass salt water ponding based on nonabraded specimen aashto tnum num days num min reduction in cl absorption num lbscu yd cl at a depth of num num max num the sealer shall not permanently stain discolor or darken the concrete .
application of the sealer shall not alter the surface texture or form a coating on the concrete surfaces .
num the sealer shall not leave residue on glass painted metal or automobiles .
num the sealer shall not reduce the bond of pavement markings or reduce the skid resistance of the surface being sealed .
any sealer determined to have these adverse effects will be removed from the pre qualified list .
num the sealer shall be delivered to the project in unopened containers with the manufacturers label identifying the product and with the seals intact .
each container shall be clearly marked by the manufacturer with the following information a manufacturers name and address .
b product name .
c date of manufacture and expiration date .
d lot identification .
num return to table of contents e storage requirements .
num manufacturer and brand name approval .
prior to approval and use of concrete sealers the manufacturer shall submit to construction and materials a certified test report from an approved testing laboratory showing specific test results conforming to the requirements of these specifications .
the certified test report shall also contain the manufacturers name product brand name lot number and date of manufacture .
upon approval of the certified test report by the engineer the manufacturer and brand name will be added to the pal designated for this specification .
new certified test results shall be submitted any time the manufacturing process or the sealer formulation is changed and may be required by the engineer when sampling and testing of material offered for use indicates nonconformance to any of the requirements herein specified .
section num concrete crack filler num scope .
this specification covers concrete crack fillers for the protection of concrete against damage from deicing chemicals .
num acceptance .
all material shall be obtained from a source identified on the pal designated for this specification except as otherwise listed below .
all materials under this specification will be inspected and accepted in accordance with sec num .
num the concrete crack filler shall be a low viscosity polymer .
the chemical composition shall meet the following requirements property test method specification viscosity aashto dnum less than or equal to num cps gel time aashto tnum less than or equal to num minutes num deg f tensile strength astm dnum greater than or equal to num psi elongation astm dnum greater than or equal to num solids content greater than or equal to num flash point astm dnum greater than or equal to num deg f cure rate aashto tnum less than or equal to num hrs num deg f num the concrete crack filler shall meet the procedures and the application rates as specified in sec num .
modot reserves the right to verify any qualification tests at their expense on any field application .
num manufacturer and brand name approval .
prior to approval and use of concrete crack fillers the manufacturer shall submit to construction and materials a certified test report from an approved testing laboratory showing specific test results conforming to the requirements of these specifications .
the certified test report shall also contain the manufacturers name product brand name lot number and date of manufacture .
upon approval of the certified test report by the engineer the manufacturer and brand name will be added to the pal designated for this specification .
new certified test results shall be submitted any time the manufacturing process or the crack filler formulation is changed and may be required by the engineer when sampling and testing of material offered for use indicates nonconformance to any of the requirements herein specified .
num return to table of contents section num concrete admixtures num scope .
this specification covers airentraining admixtures waterreducing admixtures retarding admixtures accelerating admixtures and latex emulsion admixtures for concrete .
num acceptance .
all material under this specification shall be obtained from a source identified on the pal designated for this specification .
all material under this specification will be inspected and accepted in accordance with sec num .
num airentraining admixtures .
airentraining admixtures shall be in accordance with aashto m num except as modified herein .
num certification .
the manufacturer shall submit a certification to construction and materials prior to approval .
the certification shall provide the following a the brand name and designation .
b the composition or description of the admixture .
c the manufacturing ranges for percent total solids and ph by aashto t num. d the infrared spectrum .
e the manner in which the material will be identified on containers .
f the material is in accordance with these specifications .
num certifications shall include or have attached specific test results as required in sec num or sec num .
num for an airentraining admixture other than that specified in sec num the certification shall include results of tests conforming to the requirements of aashto m num .
tests for bleeding bond strength and volume change will not be required .
num for an airentraining admixture that is an aqueous solution of vinsol resin manufactured by neutralizing the resin with sodium hydroxide the certification shall include results of tests showing the ratio of sodium hydroxide to vinsol resin .
the certification or test report shall also state that no other additive or chemical agent is present in the solution .
num packaging and marking .
the containers in which airentraining admixtures are delivered shall be plainly marked with the manufacturers name the brand name and designation of the material lot number and net quantity .
a delivery ticket showing this information shall accompany bulk shipments .
if the manufacturer supplies airentraining admixtures in more than one concentration the concentration shall be designated on the container or for bulk shipments in a prominent manner on the delivery ticket .
num waterreducing admixtures .
waterreducing admixtures shall be in accordance with aashto m num type a except as modified herein .
high range waterreducing admixtures when permitted for use shall be in accordance with aashto m num type f or type g. num certification .
the manufacturer shall submit certification to construction and materials prior to approval .

b the composition or description of the admixture .

num packaging and marking .

a delivery ticket showing this information shall accompany bulk shipments .

num return to table of contents section num concrete curing material num scope .
this specification covers material to be used for the purpose of curing concrete .
num liquid membraneforming curing compounds .
num acceptance .
all material under this specification shall be obtained from a source identified on the pal designated for this specification .
if the manufacturer is different from the source supplying the material the manufacturer shall also be listed .
all material under this specification will be inspected and accepted in accordance with sec num .
num material .
num general .
water retention properties for all curing compounds shall be determined by astm test method c num .
the vehicle class of all curing compounds shall be class a .
num type numd curing compounds .
type numd liquid membraneforming curing compounds shall be in accordance with astm c num for type numd clear or translucent with fugitive dye .
num type num curing compounds .
type num liquid membraneforming curing compounds shall be in accordance with astm c num for type num white pigmented .
num bridge curing compounds .
bridge curing compounds shall be liquid membranecuring compounds in accordance with astm c num for type numd or type num and shall be designated to be dissipating .
all bridge curing compounds shall be manufactured such that the curing compounds may be removed prior to dissipation .
num documentation .
num certification for qualification .
prior to use and in addition to the required pal documentation the manufacturer shall submit certification to construction and materials setting forth the brand name and designation the composition or description of the curing material the manner in which the material will be identified on the containers and shall list typical values of current tests for consistency drying time reflectance and moisture retention .
num additional certification .
certification for bridge curing compounds shall include a statement that the product is manufactured to dissipate .
the certification shall specify the method by which removal of the compound prior to dissipation or removal of residual material from the surface can be accomplished .
num shipment documentation .
for each shipment of material the source shall maintain the manufacturers certification and test results showing that the product is in accordance with this specification .
the manufacturers certification and test results shall be made available upon request .
num other concrete curing material .
num acceptance .
all material under this specification shall be obtained from a source identified on the pal designated for this specification .
all material under this specification will be inspected and accepted in accordance with sec num .
num material .
num waterproof paper .
waterproof paper shall be in accordance with astm c num .
num polyethylene sheeting .
polyethylene sheeting shall be in accordance with sec num for curing portland cement concrete .
num white burlappolyethylene sheeting .
white burlappolyethylene sheeting shall be in accordance with astm c num .
num return to table of contents num burlap and mats of jute or cotton .
burlap shall be fabric made from jute or other suitable fibers .
jute mats shall consist of two plies of burlap stitched together to maintain the shape and stability of the unit .
cotton mats shall consist of filler or cotton batts covered with unsized cloth or burlap and tufted or stitched to maintain the shape and stability of the unit .
burlap mats or other synthetic material equivalents shall in the judgment of the engineer be of such construction and in such a condition as required to adequately maintain free moisture on the surface of the concrete with the type of system being used to provide the water .
material shall be free from deleterious matter harmful to concrete .
num documentation .
the distributor shall maintain certification that the material supplied is in accordance with these specifications .
the certification shall be made available upon request .
num return to table of contents section num concrete tinting and staining material section num concrete tinting material num description .
this work item shall consist of providing a concrete tinting material to aesthetically color concrete as shown on the plans .
num material requirements .
this material shall consist of a homogeneous mixture mineral oxide pigment of an approved tint with such other additives as deemed necessary by the manufacturer .
the tinting material shall conform to the specification outlined on astm cnum .
the material shall be free from oil grease dirt and nonferrous particles .
the tinting material shall not contain any material that might promote oxidation of the iron particles if exposed to air and moisture or that might have any detrimental effect on concrete .
the contractor shall supply the engineer with a maufacturers certification indicating that the material supplied is in accordance with this specification .
num construction requirements .
the contractor shall incorporate the tinting material into the concrete through mixing with the aggregate cementitious material and water in accordance with the manufacturers recommendation .
the dry shake method whereby the tinting material powder combined with dry cement and sand is sprinkled onto the concrete and worked into the surface through finishing shall not be allowed .
section num concrete staining material num description .
this work item shall consist of providing a field concrete stain to aesthetically color concrete exteriors as shown on the plans .
num material requirements .
the material shall be twocoat pigmented acrylic resin system which penetrates into the concrete surface to provide water repellency semiopaque aesthetic color and salt resistance and shall form a breathable film allowing trapped moisture vapor to safely migrate through the coating without blistering or peeling .
the contractor shall supply the engineer with a manufacturers certification indicating that the material supplied is in accordance with this specification .
num construction requirements .
the concrete surface shall be fully cured a minimum of num days prior to application of the aesthetic concrete stain .
the absence of moisture in the concrete surface shall be verified with standard test astm dnum .
pressure washing with a minimum of num psi shall be used to remove all foreign matter form oils waxes curing compounds laitance efflorescence and dirt .
sand blasting will not be permitted for cleaning .
the cleaned surface shall be free of blemishes discolorations surface voids and conspicuous form marks to the satisfaction of the engineer .
the concrete stain shall be adequately mixed within its container until homogenous in color .
application of the stain shall be in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations including allowable ambient conditions .
application of the stain will not be allowed during rain .
all manufacturers safety precautions shall be submitted to the engineer prior to work and followed during staining .
num return to table of contents section num material for joints num scope .
this specification covers joint material to be used as specified or as shown on the plans .
num acceptance .
all material under this specification shall be obtained from a source identified on the pal designated for this specification .
num dowel bars .
dowels for transverse joints shall be in accordance with the requirements for plain rounds of aashto m num .
the dowels shall be epoxy coated in accordance with sec num except the coating thickness shall be a nummil minimum the flexibility of coating requirement will not apply and the cut ends will not be required to be coated .
the dowels shall be free of cutting burrs and other projections .
dowel supporting units shall be in accordance with one of the types shown on the plans .
num the free end of the dowel bar shall be coated with an approved graphite grease for a length of num inches .
graphite grease shall contain a minimum of num percent graphite and the graphite content shall be certified by the manufacturer or shown on the container label .
graphite grease shall be applied with a thin uniform coating that will result in a thorough covering of the free end of the bar .
num in lieu of the graphite grease application the dowel bar basket supplier may supply completed basket units predipped in an approved bondbreaker solution .
the bondbreaker solution shall not be applied in a spray or field application .
the resulting dry dowel bar coating shall be visually evident .
the coating shall be uniformly applied without excessive drips or thickness .
dirty or excessively scraped dowel bar units will be rejected .
rejected units may be used if the units are fully cleaned of all dirt and bondbreaker coating and graphite grease is applied according to these specifications .
the dowel basket supplier shall provide a certification for the coating with each shipment certifying the bondbreaker product name manufacturer and date of coating application .
num tie bars .
tie bars for longitudinal joints and construction joints shall be round deformed and in accordance with aashto m num except for tie bars that are to be bent and straightened shall be in accordance with aashto m num grade num .
tie bars shall not be bent and straightened more than one time .
tie bars shall be epoxy coated in accordance with sec num except the coating thickness shall be a nummil minimum the flexibility of coating requirement will not apply and the cut ends will not be required to be coated .
num concrete and asphalt joint sealer hotpoured elastic type .
the sealer material shall be in accordance with astm d num type ii .
the joint sealer material shall be packed and shipped in suitable commercial containers clearly marked with the name of the material the name of the manufacturer brand name weight batch number pouring temperature recommended by the manufacturer and maximum safe heating temperature .
num pavement joint forming material .
num preformed fiber expansion joint filler .
preformed fiber expansion joint filler material shall be in accordance with aashto m num .
percent asphalt content shall be tested in accordance with aashto t num or num with the following modifications oven dry test strips at num num c for one hour .
cool and weigh approximately num g into an extraction bowl .
cover test portion in the bowl with a chlorinated solvent such as trichloroethylene and allow sufficient time for solvent to soak the test portion .
follow test procedure outlined in aashto t num section num and num except discard extract and washings .
carefully transfer extracted test strips and scrap residue from the filter ring into a tared weighing pan .
oven dry at num num c for one num hour and cool in a desiccators .
calculate the percent asphalt content by weight on an oven dry basis per astm d num subsection num .
in cases of dispute aashto t num test results will control .
num semirigid closedcell polypropylene foam preformed expansion joint filler .
this material shall be semirigid closedcell polypropylene foam preformed expansion joint filler in accordance with astm dnum .
num joints for concrete structures .
num return to table of contents num plastic waterstop .
the plastic waterstop shall consist of a basic resin of polyvinyl chloride pvc with additional resins plasticizers and stabilizers as necessary to produce a durable material with a high fatigue point resistant to acid and alkali solutions showing little deterioration under accelerated aging tests and shall meet the approval of the engineer .
the plastic waterstop shall have a tensile strength of no less than num psi and an ultimate elongation of no less than num percent .
the waterstop shall be a continuous strip ribbed on both sides and with a hollow bulb center a u shaped reinforced centerpleat section or other approved type of center section .
num rubber waterstop .
the rubber water stop shall consist of a durable elastic cured rubber compound capable of effectively sealing joints in concrete against the infiltration of moisture .
num the rubber waterstop shall be in accordance with the following requirements a hardness the shore a durometer hardness shall be num num. b elongation the elongation shall be no less than num percent .
c tensile strength the tensile strength shall be no less than num psi .
d water absorption the water absorption shall be a maximum of five percent by weight mass after immersion in water for two days at num f. e tensile strength after aging the tensile strength of the test specimen after accelerated aging test of seven days at num f shall be no less than num percent of the tensile strength prior to the aging test .
the tensile strength of the test specimen after accelerated aging test of num hours in oxygen at num f and num psi shall be no less than num percent of the tensile strength prior to the test .
f compression set the compression set after num hours at num f shall be no more than num percent .
num the waterstop shall be manufactured in such a manner that the finished product will have an integral cross section that will be dense homogeneous and free from porosity and other imperfections .
minor surface defects such as surface peel covering less than one square inch and surface cavities or bumps less than num inch in the longest lateral dimension and less than num inch deep will be permitted .
num copper sheeting for flashing .
copper sheeting shall be of soft grade containing no less than num percent copper and shall be capable of being bent cold through an angle of num degrees flat upon itself without evidence of cracking .
test specimens shall have an elongation in num inches of at least num percent .
the weight per square foot of the sheeting to be used will be shown on the plans .
tolerances in thickness shall be in accordance with astm b num .

the physical requirements of the compound shall be in accordance with astm c num .

the outer surface shall be completely covered with a natural skin .

num silicone expansion joint sealant .
the sealant for expansion joints shall be in accordance with sec num .
the silicone joint sealant shall be a rapid cure selfleveling cold applied single or two component silicone sealant .
the sealant shall demonstrate resilience flexibility and resistance to moisture and puncture upon curing .
the sealant shall demonstrate excellent adhesion to portland cement concrete polymer concrete and steel over a range of temperatures from num to num f while maintaining a watertight seal .
the sealant shall not contain any solvents or diluents that cause shrinkage or expansion during curing .
acidcure sealants shall not be used .
the date of manufacture or use by date shall be provided with each lot of sealant or primer .
material num months old or older from the date of manufacture or past the use by date shall not be used .
the engineer reserves the right to test representative samples from material proposed for use .
if a backer rod is required it shall be closedcell material as recommended by the sealant manufacturer .

num return to table of contents section num protective coating material section num protective coatingconcrete bents and piers urethane .
num scope .
this specification covers modified urethane or polyurethane elastomeric coating to be used as shown on the plans .
this material will typically be applied under expansion devices for protection from deleterious agents in areas where aesthetics is not a high priority .
num general requirements .
the material shall be suitable for outdoor exposure and shall be resistant to deterioration by ultraviolet light .
additives for ultraviolet stabilization shall not be added after the original manufacturing process .
the material shall be suitable for application to concrete surfaces .
surface preparation shall be in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations .
the material shall be suitable for application to obtain a thickness of num mils dry film without runs or sags when applied to a vertical concrete surface .
the material shall have a minimum shelf life in unopened containers of at least six months from the date of delivery .
num cured material .
the cured material shall be in accordance with the following protective coating concrete bents and piers urethane property requirement shore a hardness astm d num material shall be cured in num mil thick film for num days at num num f at num relative humidity .
test specimen shall be composed of plied pieces to a minimum numinch thickness .
num minimum tensile strength astm d num method and time of cure may be modified as recommended by the manufacturer .
num psi minimum elongation astm d num method and time of cure may be modified as recommended by the manufacturer .
num percent minimum water vapor permeability astm d num or astm e num method bw num mil film thickness .
num perms maximum num packaging .
all twocomponent materials shall be prepackaged to exact mixing quantities .
num manufacturer and brand name qualification .
prior to approval and use the manufacturer shall submit a representative onegallon sample to construction and materials .
upon approval of the material the brand name and manufacturer will be placed on a list of qualified urethane protective coating agents for concrete bents and piers .
the sample shall be identified by brand name manufacturers name and address and shall be accompanied by the following a manufacturers complete material data showing typical test results for the properties specified generic name of the major components of the material mixing instructions surface preparation and application instructions and intended use .
b test results after num hours of exposure in an accelerated weathering device in accordance with astm d num procedure b .
the film thickness of test specimens shall be num mils and shall show no cracking flaking or blistering after exposure .
slight discoloration will be permitted .
c in lieu of the accelerated weathering test results required in sec numb the manufacturer may submit a use history showing satisfactory performance for three years in at least two exposed applications .
name address and telephone number of the users shall be included in the use history .
num acceptance .
the contractor shall furnish a manufacturers certification stating that the material supplied is in accordance with all requirements specified and that the material furnished is of the same composition as originally qualified .
the engineer reserves the right to sample the material at destination if deemed necessary .

num return to table of contents section num pull and junction boxes num scope .
this specification covers pull and junction boxes intended for use on highway lighting and traffic signal projects .
num pull boxes .
pull boxes may be castinplace concrete precast concrete preformed polymer concrete or preformed fiberglass reinforced polymer concrete .
pull box dimensions shall be as shown on the plans .
each pull box shall be equipped with cable hooks as shown on the plans .
cable hooks shall be galvanized steel or brass with a minimum diameter of num inch and a minimum length of num inches .
num castinplace concrete pull boxes shall be constructed of class b or bnum concrete or a commercial mixture in accordance with sec num .
material proportioning mixing slump and transporting of concrete shall be in accordance with sec num .
placing finishing and curing shall be in accordance with sec num .
pull boxes shall be cast in a neat and workmanlike manner .
forms will be required for the inside surfaces of the pull box walls and if the excavation is irregular forms will also be required for the outside surfaces of the walls .
an outside form shall be installed across all trenches leading into the pull box excavation .
the ends of all conduits through the walls shall fit tightly against the form .
num precast concrete pull boxes shall be constructed of class b or bnum concrete or a commercial mixture in accordance with of sec num .
material proportioning mixing slump and transporting of concrete shall be in accordance with sec num .
concrete for precast pull boxes shall be placed finished and cured in accordance with sec num .
num preformed pull boxes shall withstand a wheel load of num pounds .
pull box walls may be either flared or vertical .
metal conduit if used in preformed pull boxes shall be electrically bonded to one another inside each pull box .
num pull box covers .
each pull box shall be equipped with a bolt down cover .
the threaded hole that receives the cover lockdown bolt shall be open at the bottom to allow the cleanout of sand dirt and other debris .
lockdown bolts shall be stainless steel or brass with a pentahead .
frames and covers for castin place and precast concrete pull boxes shall be cast iron in accordance with aashto m num class num and shall be of the dimensions and weights shown on the plans .
preformed pull box covers shall be polymer concrete and shall have a minimum wheel load rating of num pounds .
a lift opening shall be provided on all covers .
covers for pull boxes to be used for highway lighting or sign lighting shall be embossed with state lighting .
covers for pull boxes to be used for traffic signals or a combination of traffic signals and num volt intersection lighting shall be embossed with state signals .
covers for pull boxes to be used for fiber optics shall be embossed with state fiber optics .
num junction boxes .
junction boxes shall be flanged and designed for flush mounting if encased in concrete or designed for surface mounting if external mounting is specified .
junction boxes shall be drilled or tapped for all conduit connections .
junction boxes shall be installed such that covers are removable .
junction boxes shall be stainless steel fiberglass or pvc watertight nema num enclosures .
pvc junction boxes shall have a minimum wall thickness of num inch .
junction boxes shall be in accordance with the following minimum sizes unless otherwise specified maximum entering conduit size inches minimum box size inches num num x num x num num num x num x num num pvc and metal conduit shall be joined to junction boxes to make a rigid and waterproof connection .
if metal conduit is used an insulated bushing shall be provided at the end of the metal conduit on the inside of the junction box to prevent scuffing of the cable insulation .
num the junction box cover shall be made watertight with a suitable gasket and secured with stainless steel or cadmium plated screws or bolts .
num certification and acceptance .
the contractor shall furnish a manufacturers certification that num return to table of contents the material supplied excepting material made from castinplace concrete is in accordance with these specifications .
num return to table of contents section num temporary traffic control devices num scope .
this specification covers material to be used for temporary traffic control devices .
num general requirements .
all temporary traffic control devices shall be manufactured as shown on the plans and as specified in accordance with mutcd requirements and shall be nchrp num compliant .
nominal dimensions will be permitted for dimensional lumber where applicable .
all temporary traffic control devices shall exhibit good workmanship and shall be free of objectionable marks or defects that affect appearance or serviceability .
the brand name or model number shall be permanently identified on each traffic control device .
num channelizers and tubular markers .
all channelizers and tubular markers shall be manufactured from a nonmetallic material pigmented and molded of a highway orange color throughout and stabilized against fading by ultraviolet or other light rays by the incorporation of adequate inhibitors .
tubular markers shall be applied with reflective sheeting meeting either astm d num type num or num .
drumlike channelizers shall be closedtop and applied with either astm d num type num or num reflective sheeting .
trimline channelizers shall be applied with white sheeting meeting either astm d num type num or num and fluorescent orange in accordance with sec num .
all retroreflective marking on channelizers and tubular markers shall be in accordance with astm d num supplemental requirements section snum .
retroreflective marking on cones will not be required .
num signs .
num rigid signs .
num sign substrate .
all signs shall be fabricated of substrate designed to provide satisfactory structural rigidity .
num sign sheeting .
all signs shall have a retroreflectorized background .
retroreflective sheeting shall be in accordance with sec num type num or fluorescent orange and yellow as shown on the plans .
sheeting shall be applied to the sign substrate in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations and the surface shall be free of air bubbles wrinkles or other blemishes as determined by the engineer .
num rollup signs .
num sign substrate .
sign and overlay blanks shall consist of either white yellow fluorescent orange andor pink microprismatic retroreflective sheeting sealed to a heavyduty coated fabric or vinyl material .
the sheeting shall have a minimum coefficient of retroreflection expressed as candelas per footcandle per square foot as shown below when measured in accordance with astm e num and shall meet the minimum color requirements in accordance with mgsnuml specification .
the color specifications shall be in accordance with astm d num .
material shall be submitted by the manufacturer to ntpep for a minimum exposure time of one year .
results shall be published by ntpep and available for modot review .
for all ntpep test decks weathered material shall be within the color specification limits .
heat and impact resistance of the sheeting shall be in accordance with the latest version of astm d num .
num overlays .
overlays when used shall be mechanically fastened to the face of the sign in a manner that will ensure the overlay remains securely attached .
fasteners shall not detract from the appearance of the sign when the overlay is not in use .
velcro fasteners will not be permitted .
num bracing .
each sign shall have a horizontal and vertical cross brace and at least one antikiting device located near the center of the sign .
cross braces of sufficient crosssection shall be fastened to each other at the midpoints and the ends securely held to the back of the sign by mechanical means .
the design shall ensure that the sign remains taut and retains the signs intended shape when exposed to normal field conditions .
num legend and borders .
legends and borders of all signs shall be vinyl or silkscreened .
vinyl shall be cut by die or a computerdriven cutter .
stencil ink used shall be in accordance with the sheeting num return to table of contents manufacturers recommendations .
freehand legend and borders will not be permitted .
num sign layout and design .
sign layout and design shall be as shown on the plans or as directed by the engineer .
num flag assembly .
flag assemblies when specified shall consist of a flag bracket and two flags .
flags shall be num in x num in fluorescent orange vinyl and be securely attached on one side to a blank suitable for displaying the flag as shown on the plans .
the flag shall not be of mesh material .
the blank shall be securely attached to the flag bracket be of sufficient crosssection to display the flag in wind speeds up to num mph and be of sufficient length to hold the flags approximately six inches from the sign .
num advance warning rails .
advanced warning rails shall be supplied as a system of three rails as shown on the plans .
the rail system may be post mounted or mounted on portable structures .
when used on post mounted signs the advance warning rails shall consists of substrate of highdensity polyethylene plastic .
the rail wall thickness shall be num in .
with white and orange reflective sheeting in accordance with sec num and shall be applied as shown on the plans .
num warning lights .
warning lights item type a low intensity type b high intensity type c steady burn sequential flashing lens directional faces num or num num num or num num flashing rate per minute num to num num to num constant num to num minimum num num num constant constant hours of operation dusk to dawn num hrsday dusk to dawn num hrsday num flashing arrow panels .
all lamps shall have a nominal numinch numdegree tunnel visor .
